identificationModule.briefTitle: Factors Related to Functional Recovery Using Brain Imaging of Stroke Patients
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Study on Factors Related to Functional Recovery Using Brain Imaging of Stroke Patients

descriptionModule.briefSummary: In this study, brain imaging predictive factors related to motor recovery will be investigated. Lastly, the prediction model will be established.

armGroups.label: Stroke
armGroups.description: Patients with ischemic or hemorrhagic stroke who were admitted to Samsung Medical Center and transferred to the Department of Physical and Rehabilitation Medicine
interventionNames: Behavioral: Data acquisition of functional abilities

interventions.name: Data acquisition of functional abilities
interventions.description: MRI data, motor evoked potentials, and behavior data acquisition

primaryOutcomes.measure: Fugl-Meyer Assessment score at 3 months after stroke onset
primaryOutcomes.description: Measurement of motor function of upper and lower extremities

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Adults more than 19 years
* First-ever unilateral stroke
* Ischemic subacute stroke patients

Exclusion Criteria:

* Major active neurological disease or psychiatric disease
* Metallic implants in their brain
* Hemorrhagic stroke
* Bilateral lesions
* Recurrent stroke
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Patients with ischemic stroke who were admitted to Samsung Medical Center and transferred to the Department of Physical and Rehabilitation Medicine
